comments:
Build ID: I20070503-1400

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Update Eclipse
2. Confirm, start download, etc...
3. ZipException =)


More information:

!STACK 0
java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(Unknown Source)

	at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FeaturePackagedContentProvider.retrieveLocalJar(FeaturePackagedContentProvider.java:256)

This happens if not to execute the Eclipse as Administrator. It could have an message instead of an error.

The call to JarProcessor.processJar was wrapped in a catch throwable for bug 187580.  So this won't stop the update anymore, it will fall back to the normal jar.  Is there anything else we can do to stop the ZipException in the first place, or does the user just not have permission?

Created an attachment (id=70746)
windows vista - shortcut properties

In windows vista the user it does not have permission for nothing.

The Zip functions if the Eclipse to execute as Administrator (see attachment). Contrary case happens error - an acknowledgment message could show in update (better form: vista User Account Control).
